Articles.Content:
Back from the dead.. my newest bird, the F-14 Tomcat, complete with working variable sweep wings. With FAR, they actually make a real difference.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I like replicating probes. I try to execute the missions in the same method, aswell. Same orbits the probes are actually on (or close enough to Kerbal)

Working towards Cassini and New Horizons, once the rest of the Kerbol System is implemented

Messenger (in Orbit around Mercury currently)

Dawn (ION Mission to the Asteroid Belt, check out Ceres, then hop to Vesta)((Sent to Dres, then made it to Eeloo))

Juno (Currently on its way to Jupiter, to be parked in a highly eccentric polar orbit to study the Magnetosphere)

Im considering doing the soviet missions to Venus... but they all failed in real life... so... wheres the fun in that?

STEREO Probes, LCROSS, LRO, Mars Odyssey, Maven are ones im looking forward to (Maybe ISS if Im feeling quite ambitious) any suggestions would be cool

Well, they didn't all fail...

none were parked in a stable orbit, all the landers barely survived the heat and pressure to transmit a handful of pictures

I might sound mean saying they all failed... but... yeah, thats what happened

;]

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Solar_System_probes
some*... not none

Actually like 1 or 2 made it alive to the surface and transmitted valuable data like pics and readings.

I'll slap some seporatrons on a dinky little probe, with them facing inward, so I can blow up the probe, haha!

Sounds about right

-supersnip-

Not to be that guy, but

Spoilers are fixed guys.

So please, if you have large amounts of images, put them in spoilers.

On the other hand, those probes are pretty good! Also, yay! Someone other than me went to Dres!

Not sure if these fit the bill of replicas, as they are all(except the phoenix lander) based on concept images from the Mars One company and they haven't been built yet (and may never get built). I particularly like the transit vehicle.

Hi! this is a stock replica of the B-2 spirit (coloured with kerbapaint plugin).

It is a 300 parts craft, she has a lot of lifting surfaces so it's a bit hard to control but it's fine.

Hi!

I`ve some replicas from old computer.

B-52H

Martin P6M Seamaster

F-15E Strike Eagle

Space Ship Two+ White Knight

Hi,

This is my first post to the forums. I've got about 300 hours in the game, and have just started using mods.

This is a sort of futuristic A-10 Thunderbolt that I wanted to share, it uses some B9 parts.

http://imgur.com/a/110Rw

Posted this in the Modded Craft Repository, but there doesn't seem to be much traffic there, so here's the replica I'm most proud of. This thing is super exciting to fly, especially in ground attack runs.

I built a P-38 Lightning replica which I'm really pleased to find flies a lot like the real P-38. I know you're going to say, sigh, just another warbird, but this one has a targetting system I'm particularly proud of.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Mods:

FAR

Kerbal Aircraft Expansion (KAX)

Procedural Wings

Skillful Weapons/Combat Damage Mod

Hullcam VDS

I know the IRL P-38 had one 20mm cannon and four 12.7mm machine guns, but I didn't have a 20mm available and ground attack is the main mode of battle in WT, so I converted it to 2x500lb and 2x 30mm autocannon. It does a number on soft ground targets with that aiming point (the rounds hit a few mm below the end of the communotron when in hullcam mode). Flies happily at about 2/3rds throttle, a speed at which you'll be hard pressed to put it into an accelerated stall in a tight turn. It's lovely! Landing is a little more hairy; keep your approach speed around 250-300km/h IAS (I think ~75m/s IAS). And give it a good, aggressive flare just before touchdown. Hope you enjoy!

Download Link

La-5

Ju-87

Finally, three new replicas coming tomorrow!

Sneak peek: All is stock.

And now... The moment you've all been waiting for...

The Bell X-1 Replica, brought to you by BriXman!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This craft was just a small thing I put together. Yes, I cheated a LITTLE bit by adding in hidden control surfaces inside the fuel tank but... it really was needed. In difference to the real thing, this has 26 engines, instead of 4...

More coming soon!

Here's three stock planes i worked on today, But keeping with the original design was second to making them work well within KSP

Javascript is disabled. View full album

From left to right

CanCorde 144 (Mix of Concorde and Tu144) (Old version in image)

Bombardier Dash 8 (No props in KSP yet!)

Seaplane (Sort of a mix between many different seaplanes (Caravan with floats & Grumman HU-16 Albatross)

Newer edition of Dash 8 With original T Tail ( I dont like T-Tails based on Deep stall )
I made a replica Ekranoplan.
